articles.title: Earnings Growth Poised to Accelerate
articles.content: A big part of this year's earnings growth is expected to come from margins reversing last year's declines and starting to expand again. The revisions trend continues to show positivity, with expectations for 2024 Q2 and full-year 2024 modestly moving higher.

articles.title: Tap the Stock Buyback Trend With PKW ETF
articles.content: Stock buybacks recently staged a strong comeback from the lull witnessed in 2023. Companies have announced share repurchases of more than $383 billion in the last 13 weeks, up 30% from the year-ago period and the highest since June 2018.

articles.title: Apple's New M4 iPads: 'More Powerful Than Any AI PC' Today, Set To Boost Sales
articles.content:
On May 7, 2024, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) announced the launch of its latest iPad models: the iPad Pro equipped with the powerful M4 chip and OLED displays, and the iPad Air now featuring the M2 chip. 
These introductions mark the first update to the iPad lineup since October 2022, signaling a significant step in Apple’s product evolution, and are expected to improve the revenue mix and drive growth going forward, according to Goldman Sachs.
Key Insights from the New iPad Launch
Goldman Sachs equity analyst Michael Ng highlighted several critical aspects of the new iPad releases that investors should note:

Support for Revenue Growth: “The introduction of the new iPad models aligns with Apple’s forecast for F3Q24E, which anticipates double-digit year-over-year growth in iPad revenue,” Ng stated. This growth is supported by clean iPad channel inventory, thanks to strategic efforts to clear out older models before the new releases. This move is particularly expected to bolster revenue trends in Greater China.
Advancements in AI and Processing Power: The new iPad Pro features Apple's latest M4 chip, which is described as “more powerful than any AI PC NPU today.” The M4 chip's Neural Engine can process up to 38 trillion operations per second, outpacing any current AI PC neural processing unit. This ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: Prominent Apple Bull Reveals Surprise Takeaway From Apple's iPad Launch: Tim Cook's AI Ambitions Now 'Lot Faster...With Announcement Of M4 Chip'
articles.content:
Prominent tech analyst Gene Munster has observed a "surprise takeaway" from Apple Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPad launch event on Tuesday where the company unveiled the M4 chip.
What Happened: Munster took to X, formerly Twitter, on Tuesday to express his thoughts on the significance of the M4 chip announcement.
He believes that this development indicates Apple’s growing speed in updating its silicon and its focus on making hardware a competitive advantage in the field of artificial intelligence (AI).
“I have a surprise takeaway from the $AAPL iPad event. Apple is getting a lot faster at updating its silicon with the announcement of the M4 chip."
See Also: Tim Cook Kicked Off iPad Event By Hyping Up Apple Vision Pro, Top Analyst Says It’s ‘Just A Reminder’ While Jim Cramer Says ‘It’s Not A Bust’
Apple first announced the first M-series branded chip in 2020, powering Macs. A year later, it announced the first iPad with an M-series chip, the 2021 iPad Pro.
It took Apple 19 months to launch the M2 chip, and since then, the time gap has continued to fall. The M3 chip came out 16 months later, ...Full story available on Benzinga.com
